story:
Our Story:


We are a brand new theater company in New York City with a mission to feature and assist actors/artists who have recently relocated to the city.  The transition to life in New York can be quite challenging for anyone, and especially so for theater artists.  Our goal is to work with those who have just made that transition.  Our budget is modest. Any donations would be a huge help to us.

 

Mission Statement:

 

The Crook has devoted itself to producing work that is challenging, provocative, inspiring, and entertaining. 


Conceived by migrant theater artists in New York, The Crook is a company committed to transition and transformation.  Working out of several home cities: New York, San Francisco, Portland, and more. We seek to identify and foster new artists. Shepherd their emergence as the new generation of Theater in New York, ushering artists through their passage to a new home city.  


The Crook provides a forum for fresh, artistic voices and ensures that our theater community remains vibrant and relevant.  We commit to keep the public informed.  It is important to us that you not only see the shows we produce, but also the hard work that goes into producing them.  The trials of a fledgling theater company can be followed on our company blog or check out our Facebook page.

 

Your Star Role in the Show:

 

Here is what your contribution can provide for us:

  • $10 will pay for one hour of rehearsal space.

  • $25 will pay for ad space in a newspaper.

  • $50 will pay for the rights of PLUNGE for one performance.

  • $200 will pay for the insurance needed for the actors and audience members for the entire run!

  • $500 will pay for materials needed to build the set.

  • $1000 will pay for the third week of our theater rental!

 

Other things the money will go toward:

  • Payment for the director and designers.

  • Advertising.

  • Postcards, Posters & Playbills

 

There are no donations too small, and every dollar helps!

 

Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Don't forget about the share tools!

story:
POST-EDINBURGH NEWS

Hello! Thanks a million to all those who contributed to our campaign.  We had a great and successful Edinburgh Festival in August. Read all about it on our blog page at www.therealmacguffins.com 
Look out for our next gigs in a town near you! Ok, mostly in London - but London's pretty big. 

UPDATE - UPDATE - UPDATE

Thank you to everyone who's got involved so far! We're doing really well! 

We've had a featured online blog in the Scotsman.com the number one paper during the festival for reviews and articles:

http://www.scotsman.com/lifestyle/performing-arts/the-real-macguffins-go-gaga-for-indiegogo-1-2962345

Now we've made a new video too! Check it out here: 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BUElTd7H9P8

Alternatively go to the 'updates' tab to see the video and the blog article. 

 

New to this campagin? Then read on...!

 

Hello. We are The Real MacGuffins – a London based sketch comedy group.

We have had two multi-5-star, sell-out runs at the Edinburgh Comedy Festival, as well as gigging across the country, supporting comedians including Stewart Lee, Dave Gorman and Perrier Award Winners Tim Vine, Phil Nichol, Adam Riches (2011) and Doctor Brown (2012).

“Hysterically funny…utterly inspired” **** Fest Mag

We are now creating a brand new show for the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2013 – it's our most exciting and ambitious project to date – but we need YOUR help to make it happen. So we’re floating ourselves. We are offering you the exclusive chance to buy a share of us. Yes – you can be a shareholder in The Real MacGuffins PLC (Performing Live Comedy).

“Charmingly foolish” - The Telegraph

We don't want to blow our own trumpet, because none of us play the trumpet so that would just be an awful noise. But we’ve shown that we can make great comedy shows, and now we need your help to take things to the next level. We are now on the brink of something special and we want you – our audience and fans – to share in that success. In fact we can't get there without you.

“Brilliantly well-crafted” **** Chortle

What We Need & What You Get

We'd like to raise £5,000 to cover vital costs. That's ambitious but not impossible, not with your help. Your investment will directly benefit the show, funding these key costs: rehearsal space hire, director's fees, booking preview shows, travel to and from Edinburgh, accommodation, PR company representation (vital when you’re one of 2,500 shows at the biggest arts festival in the world) and printing and distributing flyers and posters.

“Insanely witty writing” ***** Three Weeks

We have already paid for the venue – our previous success means we’ve got a great time slot at one of the big top four fringe venues in Edinburgh - the Festival registration fees, the compulsory listings in the Fringe guide and the Comedy Festival catalogue. A total of over £3,000.

 "The perfect blend of clever and silly" ***** Spank

You can help us with any amount of money that you like, from one pound to a hundred-thousand-million if you wish. That would be great! But seriously just £1 would be incredibly helpful. Or you can purchase one of the share options we've devised. They're on the right hand side of the page -

 "A relentless display of wit and creativity" ***** FreshAir.Org

What if we don't reach our goal? Fingers crossed we do. But any money you raise through our share scheme will be gratefully received and all the money will be invested in the show. Whether you buy into a share option or just make a small contribution for an amount of your choosing – every pound will help. What if we raise more? Well, fingers crossed we can! Then you'll be providing a platform for future success. Any additional money can be used to send the show on a national tour after Edinburgh and it will allow The Real MacGuffins PLC to continue to produce a high standard of live shows, radio work and YouTube content, throughout 2013 and beyond.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far, we hope we've captured your imagination, but there's just one final thing. You can help us build up shares in other ways too – by sharing this campaign!

Please help us get the word out – the more people that see this, the more chance we have of reaching our goal. Please share this link with as many people as you can. There's icons above to help spread the word though Facebook, Twitter and other social networks.

Take a look at the Share Options available at the side of the page, or you can make a contribution of any amount. Anything you can offer is sincerely and gratefully received.

Thank you for your support.


Dan, Jim and Matt

The Real MacGuffins

“Brilliantly well-crafted” **** Chortle
What We Need & What You Get
We'd like to raise £5,000 to cover vital costs. That's ambitious but not impossible, not with your help. Your investment will directly benefit the show, funding these key costs: rehearsal space hire, director's fees, booking preview shows, travel to and from Edinburgh, accommodation, PR company representation (vital when you’re one of 2,500 shows at the biggest arts festival in the world) and printing and distributing flyers and posters.
“Insanely witty writing” ***** Three Weeks
We have already paid for the venue – our previous success means we’ve got a great time slot at one of the big top four fringe venues in Edinburgh - the Festival registration fees, the compulsory listings in the Fringe guide and the Comedy Festival catalogue. A total of over £3,000.
 "The perfect blend of clever and silly" ***** Spank
You can help us with any amount of money that you like, from one pound to a hundred-thousand-million if you wish. That would be great! But seriously just £1 would be incredibly helpful. Or you can purchase one of the share options we've devised. They're on the right hand side of the page -
 "A relentless display of wit and creativity" ***** FreshAir.Org


What if we don't reach our goal? Fingers crossed we do. But any money you raise through our share scheme will be gratefully received and all the money will be invested in the show. Whether you buy into a share option or just make a small contribution for an amount of your choosing – every pound will help. What if we raise more? Well, fingers crossed we can! Then you'll be providing a platform for future success. Any additional money can be used to send the show on a national tour after Edinburgh and it will allow The Real MacGuffins PLC to continue to produce a high standard of live shows, radio work and YouTube content, throughout 2013 and beyond.
Other Ways You Can Help


If you've read this far, we hope we've captured your imagination, but there's just one final thing. You can help us build up shares in other ways too – by sharing this campaign!
Please help us get the word out – the more people that see this, the more chance we have of reaching our goal. Please share this link with as many people as you can. There's icons above to help spread the word though Facebook, Twitter and other social networks.
Take a look at the Share Options available at the side of the page, or you can make a contribution of any amount. Anything you can offer is sincerely and gratefully received. 
Thank you for your support.
Dan, Jim and Matt
The Real MacGuffins

story:
The PITCH

My name is Samantha Ciavarella and I have recently stumbled into the world of playwrighting and producing my own shows.  I am one of five other shows chosen for the full length portion of the Strawberry Theater Festival this upcoming August.  I have competed in the Strawberry Festival before and I understand the high cost of producing a show, and that's where YOU come in.

 

Break Room is a simple story that packs a crazy punch.  A nice guy is pushed to his breaking point after teasing and bullying from his co-workers becomes too much, and he's driven to do the unexpected.  The underlying theme here is bullying and the impact words have on people, even when you think you're just "fooling around".  As kids we're taught that "sticks and stones can break your bones but names will never hurt me."  Well, as adults, sometimes the names can hurt you and sometimes you do things you never thought you were capable of.  It is my goal to explore those breaking points with my actors and deliver a play to audiences that teaches people to watch what they say because their words can have dire consequences.

 

I really love this festival and I'm very excited about it!  My cast is amazing too!  Featuring the unbelievable talent of Daniel Harward, Andrew Mauney, Iliana Inocencio, and Abigail Raye, and directed by myself and Chris Bennett, this is going to be a good time.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $1,000 dollars for a couple of reasons:

1.  The fee to get into the festival was... substantial. 

2.  I need to buy some costumes and props for the production.

3.  Every actors dream is to get paid for the hard work they do... It's my dream as a producer to provide a small stipend for my talented cast.

 

The Impact

By funding the production of Break Room you are helping get a very serious message across to audiences.  Bullying will never stop, but perhaps through theater, film, and other creative venues, we can get the word out to people that words hurt... and sometimes have terrible consequences.

During March of this year I participated for the first time in the STF with my first play "Writers Retreat".  I wass met with a few unexpected successes.  I was nominated for Best Play, Best Actress, and Best Actor (Andrew Schoomaker winning in that category!)  Also, Writers Retreat is currently being published by the Riant Theater.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't fund this project, that's cool!  I get it!  Life costs money to live and sometimes you would rather eat or pay your rent instead of fund a project on indie-go-go.  HOWEVER, you can still come SEE the play happening this August at The Hudson Guild Theater in Manhattan.  Here's the link to buy tickets!

 

http://www.therianttheatre.com/index.php?n=strawberry_theatre_festival

story:
Dear Friends,

We need your support with 

INGMAR BERGMAN'S PERSONA

adapted from Bergman's shooting script

directed by CRAIG BALDWIN  

designed by DANE LAFFREY   lighting design by CORY PATTAK

featuring AYSAN CELIK, MICHAEL RUDKO and NICK WESTRATE

A young psychiatric nurse and a famous stage actress share a season, a house, and a psyche.

It is a project dear to our hearts, and one we have been working on for two years now.  It started in our living rooms, expanded to a workshop presentation and now we have been chosen to present five performances as part of HERE Arts Center's "Summer Sublet Series".  This provides our first opportunity to showcase the production with fully realized performances in a New York venue.  But in order to perform we need to raise $2500 in production costs.

That $2500 will go toward our set, costumes, lighting, sound and video equipment and rehearsal space.

This show is a wild and woolly, psychedelic ride through the remote depths of the human psyche.  It is a real risk for us artistically.  We are all working hard for no money in ways we've never worked before - and we believe as theater artists that those risks are worth taking.  The results are going to be explosive and one-of-a-kind.  Please help us realise this important work.

$10 or $20 will make a huge difference.  Please also consider a $50 or greater contribution, which will include tickets to the show (normally $15 each) and other exciting perks!

The performances are:

August 2 - 4 @ 8:30pm

August 4 & 5 @ 4pm

Information and tickets are at
http://www.here.org/shows/detail/991/

story:
What is missing in our community? 

…a space that promotes and supports development of the performing artist. Our community is rich in live theatre, but there is a lack of physical space where people of all ages can have opportunities to explore their creativity, learn skills, and build confidence. 

 ALL THAT IS ABOUT TO CHANGE! 

Since 1973, Humboldt Light Opera Company (HLOC) has produced more than 120 major musicals, light operas, and operas. We have also been a vital part of performing arts education on the North Coast. Through our active KidCo program, adult classes in singing, tap and more, we have taught performing arts to thousands of our community members. Throughout this time we have been “space-challenged”-- teaching and rehearsing in spaces we could only use for limited periods of time. 

 HLOC has been looking for and has now found the perfect SPACE to expand our multi-generational classes, and WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THIS NEW Sunnybrae Performing Arts Center for Education 
A REALITY!

We have walls to construct, dance floors and mirrors to install, and an office to furnish. With your help and our dedicated crew of volunteers, we will have two large classrooms/rehearsal halls, a lobby and office, as well as storage space for sets and costumes, and a sewing area. We will be able to hold a variety of classes and rehearsals for our shows, as well as recital and small workshop performances.  

We are so excited! We can’t wait! 

With this new space we will be able to increase our HLO KidCo offerings. In addition, we will be able to design a unique array of classes to benefit adults and older members of our community. Research shows that performing arts education stimulates mental, physical, and emotional well-being in all ages. 

Humboldt Light Opera Company has always been a volunteer, self-sustaining non-profit organization dedicated to increasing participation in the performing arts for individuals and improving quality of life for our rural community. We believe that HLOC’s SPACE will be an educational gathering place that will enrich all of our lives.

Why Indiegogo?

We need your help to create this S.P.A.C.E. (Sunnybrae Performing Arts Center for Education).   We need to raise $15,000 to remodel the existing space into two large classrooms and make appropriate ADA changes.  We are asking for your help to purchase wood, doors, mirrors, paint, soundproofing, carpet, office furniture and equipment, signage and additional items to build a safe, functional and beautiful SPACE for all!

No contribution is too big or too small!


Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone has the means to help monetarily but it would be greatly appreciated if you can spread the word to friends and family who believe in our efforts.  Email, Facebook and Twitter are good tools to get the word out.  Or contact us if you would like to donate material or help us with the remodel. (info@hloc.org)

Beyond the Stage Sample Classes

Children’s Classes:

Mom and Me Music

HLO KidCo – musical theatre training for children 4 to 18 years

Children’s Choir

Adult and 55+ Classes:

Children’s Storytime

Balance thru Gentle Movement

Singing

Living History Storytelling

Acting

Tap

Piano Performance

Music Appreciation

The Broadway Musical

Theatre Cooperative Classes:

(taught in conjunction with other local theatres)

Directing

Stage Management

Tool Safety

Basic Sewing for Costuming

Voice-overs

Social Dance for Theatre

Singing for Dancers

History of Choreography

TRULY A SPACE FOR ALL!

story:
This presentation text is first in ENGLISH

Cette présentation est en FRANÇAIS après la version anglaise

Esta presentación está en CASTELLANO después de las versiones inglesa y francesa

       


European Ballet Concordances

Crowdfunding campaign

This early dance collaborative needs your help getting their new show Concordances on stage

The Donaires Ensemble, and its choreographer ANA YEPES, are launching a “crowdfunding” campaign in order to raise the funds necessary to secure the budget of their next creation, CONCORDANCES, a European ballet for 9 dancers and 5 musicians.

Coproduction of 3 companies :

  • The Donaires Ensemble, directed by ANA YEPES, Evreux, Haute Normandie, France.

        Ensemble Donaïres                      Ana Yepes

  • The Compagnie Outre Mesure, directed by ROBIN JOLY, Vendée, France.

    Compagnie Outre Mesure

  • RenaiDanse, directed by VÉRONIQUE DANIELS, Bâle, Switzerland.

    RenaiDanse                                        Véronique Daniels 

    The Donaires Ensemble did not obtain the subventions that it was counting on for this première, and can’t provide its part of the coproduction due to lack of funds. This is why we are calling on your generosity and launching this appeal to crowd funding.

    For more information on CONCORDANCES, on the program, the three companies and the choreographers:

    Concordances

    Concordance dossier pdf in English

      


Argument

Let us imagine a dance company of today, accompanied by five timeless troubadours, visiting the dance halls and royal courts of 16th and 17th century Europe. The choreographies of the most illustrious Ballet Masters will, for a passing moment, animate our dancers. At ease in their century, they dance choreographies, and play their repertory of dance music while retaining their own fantasies. Thus they visit, each in its turn, Domenico da Piacenza near the Palazzo Schifanoia (literally, Palace « Disdains Boredom ») of Ferrare, les proteges of Margueritte of Bourgogne’s Court, the festivities of Poitiers and Langres frequented by Thoinot Arbeau, the first court ballets accompanied par Cesare Negri (violinist of King of France Henry III). They understand that the dance steps used in Sevilla and taught by Jaque and Juan de Esquivel in the Iberian peninsula have something to do with those described by Fabritio Caroso or by a French choreographer officiating at Darmstadt in Germany at the beginning of the XVII century or still others admitted into the famous “Gallery of Mirrors” of the Versailles Castle.

Thus, this voyage opens the perspective on the evident and rich musical, choreographic and poetic Concordances. Musicians and dancers converse and thrive in the veritable, interdisciplinary Concordances at the heart of these movimenti, ruades, floretas, as well as other improvisations…


Distribution

Direction of the Ensemble Donaïres :Ana Yepes

Direction of the Compagnie Outre Mesure : Robin Joly

Direction of RenaiDanse :Véronique Daniels

Concept of the show & Choreographies : Véronique Daniels, Robin Joly & Ana Yepes

Musical arrangements : Pascale Boquet

Scenic direction : Ana Yepes

Lighting creation & Stage manager : Luc Quaglia

Costumes conception:Louise-Alice Véret

Costumes realasisation: Nadia Boissard & Louise-Alice Véret

Artists

Musicians of the Compagnie Outre Mesure

Pascale Boquet • lute & “guiterne”

Anne Dumont • sakbut & harpsichord

Robin Joly • oboes & recorders

Gwinnevire Quenel • singer & recorder

Michèle Vandenbroucque • oboes, bassoons & recorder

Dancers of the three companies

Jean-Marie Belmont

Nadia Boissard

Olivier Collin

Véronique Daniels • choreographies  of XV and XVI century Italian dances

Gloria Giordano

Robin Joly • choreographies of French Renaissance dances

Sarasa Matsumoto

Anna Romaní

Ana Yepes • choreographies of XVII and XVIII century French and Spanish dances


Tour in 2014

Première at the Court Dance Festival in Cracow, Poland,  july 27

Performance at Nieul/l’Autise, Vendée, France, august 8

Performance at  Maillezais, Vendée, France, septembre 21

Performance at  Saint-Mars-la-Jaille Vendée, France, septembre 22

Performance at  Fontenay-le-Comte, Vendée, France, octobre 24 


Link with the costumes drawings

Concordances costume designs

                   


CHOOSE A PERK

TITLE

Participation

Perk

Farandole

15$  = (11€)

Mention on the web site of Donaïres Ensemble

Bassa Danza

35$ = (25€ )

The above perks + photos of the show to download

Passepied

70$ = (50€ )

The above perks + the “making of” video to download link.

Gaillarde

135$ = (100€ )

The above perks + full-length video of the show to download /or 2 invitations to a performance

Canarios

350$ = (250€ )

The above perks + poster of the show signed by the artists

Sarabande

700$ = (515€ )

The above perks + attend a rehearsal of the show before a performance /or an email conversation with Ana Yepes (choreographer, baroque dance specialist) 

Folías

2.500$ = (1.800€ )

The above perks + dinner with the artists after a performance /or lunch with Ana Yepes (choreographer, baroque dance specialist) /or a telephone conversation with her.

Concordances

14.000$ = (10.000€ )

A performance of Concordances - Professional expenses (travel, accommodations and per diems) for 15 persons not included
Payment types

You can pay by credit card or by PayPal

Open a PayPal account

If you do not have a PayPal account, you can also pay through PayPal as a guest:

How to pay through Paypal without an account

Budget of Concordances

The global budget of the Concordances production is 60.000€

We are currently lacking 20.000$ (15.500€) to close the budget for this production; these are the funds we need your help raising.

Other subjects in need of funding

If, through your generosity we overshoot our goal, please know that your help will be used to:

-  Finance the operating costs of the Donaires Ensemble which, because of the lack of any subventions, is yet provided for in 2014 nor in 2015.

-  Finance a part of dance research, being conducted by Ana Yepes, in collaboration with Anna Romaní, in order to publish the first volume of the collection: Dance in the Spanish Golden Age, The Treatises, Spanish transcriptions, with translations in English and French.

Other ways you can help

You can help simply by sharing this information about our crowdfunding campaign with your contacts. This simple gesture can open doors for us. Your help in diffusing the news could make the difference in giving the project exposure and bringing it to completion.

That’s why we thank you in advance for the time it will take you to do so.

We thank you for your attention, your support and for your generosity.

Sincerely,

Ana Yepes, the Donaïres Ensemble, and the entire team of CONCORDANCES.

        



EN FRANÇAIS

Notre collectif de musique et danse ancienne a besoin de ton aide pour réaliser son nouveau spectacle Concordances.

L’Ensemble Donaïres et sa chorégraphe ANA YEPES lancent un Financement Participatif ou “crowdfunding” afin de réunir les fonds nécessaires pour clore le budget de leur prochaine création, CONCORDANCES, ballet européen pour 9 danseurs et 5 musiciens.

Coproduction de 3 compagnies :

-  L’Ensemble Donaïres, dirigé par ANA YEPES, Evreux, Haute Normandie, France.

Ensemble Donaïres                         Ana Yepes

-  La Compagnie Outre Mesure, dirigée par ROBIN JOLY, Vendée, France.

Compagnie Outre Mesure

-  RenaiDanse, dirigée par VÉRONIQUE DANIELS, Bâle, Suisse.

RenaiDanse                                 Véronique Daniels

 L’Ensemble Donaïres n’a finalement pas reçu les subventions qu’il espérait avoir pour cette création et ne peut apporter sa part de coproduction faute de moyens. C’est pourquoi nous lançons ce Financement Participatif et faisons appel à votre générosité, chacun selon ses moyens, afin de nous aider à boucler notre budget de création.

Pour plus d’information sur CONCORDANCES, sur le programme, les trois compagnies et les chorégraphes voir

Concordances

Concordances - dossier pdf en français

               


Argument

Imaginons une compagnie de danse d’aujourd’hui accompagnée de cinq ménétriers intemporels visitant les dansoirs des cours européennes du XVe au XVIIe siècle. Les chorégraphies des plus illustres Maîtres de ballet vont alors, le temps d’un passage, animer nos danseurs. Bien dans leur siècle, ils dansent ces chorégraphies et jouent ces danseries de répertoire en gardant leurs propres fantaisies. Ainsi, ils croisent tour à tour Domenico da Piacenza près du Palazzo Schifanoia (littéralement « Palais dédaigne l’ennui ») de Ferrare, les protégés de la Cour de Margueritte de Bourgogne, les fêtes de Poitiers et Langres fréquentées par Thoinot Arbeau, les premiers ballets de cours accompagnés par Cesare Negri (violoniste du Roi de France Henry III). Ils comprennent que les pas de danse pratiqués à Séville et enseignés par Jaque et Juan de Esquivel dans la péninsule ibérique ont quelque chose à voir avec ceux décrits par Fabritio Caroso ou par un chorégraphe français officiant à Darmstadt en Allemagne au début du XVIIe siècle ou encore ceux admis dans la célèbre « Galerie des glaces » du Château de Versailles.

Création lumière & Régie plateau : Luc Quaglia

Conception des costumes : Louise-Alice Véret

Réalisation des costumes : Nadia Boissard & Louise-Alice Véret

Ainsi, ce voyage ouvre une perspective sur les évidentes et riches Concordances musicales, chorégraphiques ou poétiques. Musiciens et danseurs dialoguent et s’épanouissent dans de véritables Concordances interdisciplinaires au cœur de ces movimenti, ruades, floretas et autres improvisations…

Distribution

Direction de l’Ensemble Donaïres : Ana Yepes

Direction de la Compagnie Outre Mesure : Robin Joly

Direction de RenaiDanse :Véronique Daniels

Ecriture du spectacle & Chorégraphies : Véronique Daniels, Robin Joly & Ana Yepes

Arrangements musicaux : Pascale Boquet

Mise en scène : Ana Yepes

Artistes

Musiciens de la Compagnie Outre Mesure

Pascale Boquet • luth & guiterne

Anne Dumont • sacqueboute & clavecin

Robin Joly • hautbois & flûtes à bec

Gwinnevire Quenel • chant & flûtes à bec

Michèle Vandenbroucque • hautbois, bassons & flûtes à bec

Danseurs des trois compagnies

Jean-Marie Belmont

Nadia Boissard

Olivier Collin

Véronique Daniels • chorégraphies des danses italiennes des XVe et XVIe siècles

Gloria Giordano

Robin Joly • chorégraphies des danses de la Renaissance française

Sarasa Matsumoto

Anna Romaní

Ana Yepes • chorégraphies des danses espagnoles et françaises des XVIIe et XVIIIe siècles


Tournée en 2014

Création au Festival de Danses de Cour de Cracovie, Pologne, le 27 juillet 2014

Représentation à Nieul/l’Autise, Vendée, France, le 8 août

Représentation à Maillezais, Vendée, France, le 21 septembre

Représentation à Saint-Mars-la-Jaille Vendée, France, le 22 septembre

Représentation de Fontenay-le-Comte, Vendée, France, le 24 octobre

Budget de Concordances

Le budget global de la production de Concordances est de 60.000€

Il nous manquent actuellement 20.000$ (15.500€) pour boucler le budget de la production, ce qui correspond à la somme minimum que nous souhaitons réunir à cette occasion.

Autres sujets pour réunir des fonds

Si votre générosité permet de réunir une somme supérieure à celle demandée au départ, sachez que votre aide sera la bienvenue tout de même, car elle nous permettra alors de :

-  Financer les coûts de fonctionnement de l’Ensemble Donaïres qui, faute de subvention, n’est pas encore financé, tant pour 2014 que pour 2015.

-  Financer une part de la recherche en danse, réalisée actuellement par Ana Yepes et sa collaboratrice Anna Romaní pour la sortie du premier volume de la collection La Danse au Siècle d’Or espagnol, Les Traités, transcriptions en espagnol, avec des traductions en l’anglais et en français.

Autre façon d’aider

Ce simple geste de relayer l’information peut nous ouvrir des portes. C’est grâce à cette diffusion, également participative, que le projet pourra être connu et voir le jour.

C’est pourquoi nous vous remercions d’avance du temps que vous prendrez pour le faire.

Nous vous remercions de votre attention, de votre soutien et de votre générosité.

Amicalement,

Ana Yepes, l’Ensemble Donaïres et toute l’équipe de CONCORDANCES.

    



EN CASTELLANO 

Ballet Europeo Concordances 

Proyecto de FINANCIACIÓN PARTICIPATIVA

Este colectivo de música y danza antigua necesita de tu ayuda para llevar al escenario su nueva pieza Concordances

El Ensemble Donaïres y su coreógrafa ANA YEPES, lanzan un “Crowfunding” o Financiación Participativa con el fin de reunir los fondos necesarios para cerrar el presupuesto del próximo estreno, CONCORDANCES [Concordancias], ballet europeo para 9 bailarines y 5 músicos.

Coproducción de 3 compañías :

-  El Ensemble Donaïres, dirigido por ANA YEPES, Evreux, Haute Normandie, Francia.

Ensemble Donaïres            Ana Yepes

-  La Compagnie Outre Mesure, dirigido por ROBIN JOLY, Vendée, Francia.

Compagnie Outre Mesure      

-  RenaiDanse, dirigido por VÉRONIQUE DANIELS, Basilea, Suiza.

RenaiDanse                                 Véronique Daniels

 El Ensemble Donaïres no ha recibido las subvenciones que esperaba obtener para la realización de este espectáculo y no puede aportar su parte de coproducción. Por ello lanzamos esta financiación participativa.

Para mayor información sobre CONCORDANCES, sobre el programa, las tres compañías y los coreógrafos

Concordances

Pdf del dossier de Concordances en castellano



Argumento

Imaginemos que una compañía de danza actual, acompañada por cinco ministriles intemporales, esté visitando los antiguos salones de danza de las cortes europeas desde el siglo XV hasta el siglo XVII. En cada etapa, las coreografías de los más ilustres Maestros de ballet animan entonces a nuestros bailarines. Adaptados al siglo que atraviesan, van bailando estas coreografías y tocando esas dancerías de repertorio a la par que conservan sus propias fantasías. Así se encuentran sucesivamente con Domenico da Piacenza cerca del Palazzo Schifanoia (literalmente Palacio « Desprecia-el fastidio ») de Ferrara, los favoritos de la Corte de Margarita de Borgoña, las fiestas de Poitiers y Langres frecuentadas por Thoinot Arbeau, los primeros ballets de corte acompañados por Cesare Negri (violinista del Rey de Francia Henry III). Entienden que los pasos de danzas practicados en Sevilla y enseñados por Jaque y Juan de Esquivel en la península ibérica tienen algo que ver con  los que describen Fabritio Caroso o  un coreógrafo francés ejerciendo su oficio en Darmstadt (Alemania) a principio del siglo XVIIe,  o también con los que se admiten en el famoso Salón de los espejos del Palacio de Versalles.

Este viaje abre entonces una perspectiva sobre las evidentes y ricas Concordancias musicales, coreográficas o poéticas. Músicos y bailarines dialogan y desarrollan su arte en verdaderas Concordancias interdisciplinarias en medio de estos movimenti, ruades, floretas y otras improvisaciones…

Presupuesto de Concordances

El presupuesto global de Concordances es de 60.000€. Actualmente nos faltan 20.000$ (15.500€) para completar el presupuesto de la producción, y corresponde a la cantidad mínima que nos gustaría reunir en esta ocasión.

Otros objetivos para reunir fondos

Si vuestra generosidad nos permite reunir un cifra superior a la que hemos pedido, os informamos que vuestra ayuda sigue siendo la bienvenida porque nos permitiría entonces:

-  Financiar les costos de funcionamiento del Ensemble Donaïres que, por falta de subvención, no está cubiertos todavía para 2014, ni para 2015.

-  Financiar una parte de la investigación en danza que están realizando Ana Yepes y su colaboradora Anna Romaní para la colección La Danza del Siglo de Oro español, Tratados, transcripciones en español, con traducciones en inglés y en francés.

Otra manera de colaborar

Nos podéis ayudar también sencillamente con el hecho de difundir esta información sobre nuestra campaña de financiación participativa a vuestros contactos.

Este simple gesto de transmitir la información nos puede abrir puertas. Es gracias a esta difusión, participativa a su vez, que la campaña podrá llega a su fin con éxito.

Por ello os agradecemos por adelantado el tiempo que os tomareis para hacerlo.

Os agradecemos vuestra atención, vuestro apoyo y vuestra generosidad.

Un saludo amistoso

Ana Yepes, el Ensemble Donaïres y todo el equipo de CONCORDANCES.

Crowdfunding campaign
This early dance
collaborative needs your help getting their new show Concordances on stage
The Donaires
Ensemble, and its choreographer ANA YEPES, are launching a “crowdfunding” campaign in order to raise the funds
necessary to secure the budget of their next creation, CONCORDANCES, a European ballet for 9 dancers and 5 musicians.
Coproduction of 3 companies :


The
Donaires Ensemble, directed by ANA
YEPES, Evreux, Haute Normandie, France.
    Ensemble Donaïres                      Ana Yepes


The Compagnie Outre Mesure, directed
by ROBIN JOLY, Vendée, France.
Compagnie Outre Mesure


RenaiDanse, directed
by VÉRONIQUE DANIELS, Bâle, Switzerland.
RenaiDanse                                        Véronique Daniels 
The Donaires Ensemble did not obtain the
subventions that it was counting on for this première, and can’t provide its
part of the coproduction due to lack of funds. This is why we are calling on
your generosity and launching this appeal to crowd funding.

For more information on CONCORDANCES, on the program, the three companies and the choreographers:
Concordances
Concordance dossier pdf in English


       Argument
Let us imagine a dance company of today, accompanied
by five timeless troubadours, visiting the dance halls and royal courts of 16th
and 17th century Europe. The choreographies of the most illustrious Ballet
Masters will, for a passing moment, animate our dancers. At ease in their
century, they dance choreographies, and play their repertory of dance music
while retaining their own fantasies. Thus they visit, each in its turn,
Domenico da Piacenza near the Palazzo Schifanoia (literally, Palace « Disdains
Boredom ») of Ferrare, les proteges of Margueritte of Bourgogne’s Court, the
festivities of Poitiers and Langres frequented by Thoinot Arbeau, the first
court ballets accompanied par Cesare Negri (violinist of King of France Henry
III). They understand that the dance steps used in Sevilla and taught by Jaque
and Juan de Esquivel in the Iberian peninsula have something to do with those
described by Fabritio Caroso or by a French choreographer officiating at
Darmstadt in Germany at the beginning of the XVII century or still others
admitted into the famous “Gallery of Mirrors” of the Versailles Castle.
Thus,
this voyage opens the perspective on the evident and rich musical,
choreographic and poetic Concordances. Musicians and dancers converse
and thrive in the veritable, interdisciplinary Concordances at the heart
of these movimenti, ruades, floretas, as well as other improvisations…

Budget of
Concordances

The global budget of the Concordances production is 60.000€
We are currently lacking 20.000$ (15.500€) to close the
budget for this production; these are the funds we need your help raising.
Other subjects
in need of funding

If, through your generosity we overshoot our
goal, please know that your help will be used to:
- 
Finance the operating costs
of the Donaires Ensemble which, because of the lack of any subventions, is yet
provided for in 2014 nor in 2015.
- 
Finance a part of dance
research, being conducted by Ana Yepes, in collaboration with Anna Romaní, in
order to publish the first volume of the collection: Dance in the Spanish Golden Age, The Treatises, Spanish transcriptions, with translations in English
and French.


Other ways you
can help

You can help simply by sharing this information
about our crowdfunding campaign with your contacts. This simple gesture can
open doors for us. Your help in diffusing the news could make the difference in
giving the project exposure and bringing it to completion.
That’s why we thank you in
advance for the time it will take you to do so.

We thank you for your attention, your support and for your generosity.
Sincerely,

sur le programme, les trois compagnies et les chorégraphes voirConcordancesConcordances - dossier pdf en français                Argument
Imaginons une
compagnie de danse d’aujourd’hui accompagnée de cinq ménétriers intemporels
visitant les dansoirs des cours européennes du XVe au XVIIe siècle. Les
chorégraphies des plus illustres Maîtres de ballet vont alors, le temps d’un
passage, animer nos danseurs. Bien dans leur siècle, ils dansent ces
chorégraphies et jouent ces danseries de répertoire en gardant leurs propres
fantaisies. Ainsi, ils croisent tour à tour Domenico da Piacenza près du
Palazzo Schifanoia (littéralement « Palais dédaigne l’ennui »)
de Ferrare, les protégés de la Cour de Margueritte de Bourgogne, les fêtes de
Poitiers et Langres fréquentées par Thoinot Arbeau, les premiers ballets de
cours accompagnés par Cesare Negri (violoniste du Roi de France Henry III). Ils
comprennent que les pas de danse pratiqués à Séville et enseignés par Jaque et Juan de Esquivel dans la
péninsule ibérique ont quelque chose à voir avec ceux décrits par Fabritio
Caroso ou par un chorégraphe français officiant à Darmstadt en Allemagne au
début du XVIIe siècle ou encore ceux admis dans la célèbre « Galerie des
glaces » du Château de Versailles.

Ballet Europeo Concordances Proyecto de FINANCIACIÓN PARTICIPATIVAEste colectivo de música y danza antigua necesita de tu ayuda para llevar al escenario su nueva pieza Concordances


El Ensemble Donaïres y
su coreógrafa ANA YEPES, lanzan un “Crowfunding” o Financiación Participativa
con el fin de reunir los fondos necesarios para cerrar el
presupuesto del próximo estreno, CONCORDANCES
[Concordancias], ballet europeo para
9 bailarines y 5 músicos.
Coproducción de 3 compañías : 
- 
El Ensemble
Donaïres, dirigido por ANA YEPES, Evreux, Haute Normandie, Francia.Ensemble Donaïres            Ana Yepes
- 
La Compagnie
Outre Mesure, dirigido por ROBIN JOLY, Vendée, Francia.Compagnie Outre Mesure      
- 
RenaiDanse, dirigido
por VÉRONIQUE DANIELS, Basilea, Suiza.RenaiDanse                                 Véronique Daniels
 El Ensemble Donaïres no ha recibido las subvenciones que esperaba obtener para la realización de este
espectáculo y no puede aportar su parte de coproducción. Por ello lanzamos
esta financiación participativa.
Para mayor información sobre CONCORDANCES, sobre el programa, las tres compañías y los coreógrafosConcordancesPdf del dossier de Concordances en castellanoArgumento
Imaginemos que una compañía de danza actual, acompañada por cinco
ministriles intemporales, esté visitando los
antiguos salones de danza de las cortes europeas desde el siglo XV hasta el
siglo XVII. En cada etapa, las coreografías de los más ilustres Maestros de
ballet animan entonces a nuestros bailarines. Adaptados
al siglo que atraviesan, van bailando estas coreografías y tocando esas dancerías de repertorio a la par que
conservan sus propias fantasías. Así se encuentran sucesivamente con Domenico
da Piacenza cerca del Palazzo Schifanoia (literalmente
Palacio « Desprecia-el fastidio ») de Ferrara, los favoritos de
la Corte de Margarita de Borgoña, las fiestas de Poitiers y Langres
frecuentadas por Thoinot Arbeau, los primeros ballets de corte acompañados por
Cesare Negri (violinista del Rey de Francia Henry III). Entienden que los pasos de danzas practicados en Sevilla y enseñados por
Jaque y Juan de Esquivel en la península ibérica tienen algo que ver con  los que describen Fabritio Caroso o  un coreógrafo francés ejerciendo su oficio en
Darmstadt (Alemania) a principio del siglo XVIIe,  o también con los que se admiten en el famoso Salón de los espejos del
Palacio de Versalles.
Este viaje
abre entonces una perspectiva sobre las evidentes y ricas Concordancias musicales,
coreográficas o poéticas. Músicos y bailarines dialogan y desarrollan su arte
en verdaderas Concordancias interdisciplinarias en medio de estos movimenti, ruades, floretas y otras
improvisaciones…
Reparto
Dirección de la Compagnie Outre Mesure: Robin Joly
Dirección del Ensemble Donaïres: Ana Yepes
Dirección de RenaiDanse: Véronique Daniels
Escritura del espectáculo  & coreografías: Véronique
Daniels, Robin Joly & Ana Yepes
Arreglos musicales: Pascale Boquet
Puesta en escena:Ana Yepes
Diseño de iluminación &
regidor:Luc Quaglia
Concepción de vestuario:
Louise-Alice Véret
Realización de vestuario: Nadia
Boissard & Louise-Alice Véret

en 2014

julio

Las
Participaciones y las Contrapartidas





Farandole


15$  = (11€) 


Mención en la página web del l’Ensemble
  Donaïres




Bassa Danza 


35$ = (25€ )


La contrapartida precedente + fotos del espectáculo a descargar de la web




Passepied


70$ = (50€ )


Las contrapartidas precedentes + vídeo del
  “making of” del espectáculo a
  descargar de la web




Gaillarde


135$ = (100€ )


Las contrapartidas precedentes + vídeo
  del espectáculo a descargar de la web / o 2 invitaciones para una representación




Canarios


350$ = (250€ )


Las contrapartidas precedentes + cartel del espectáculo firmada por los artistas




Sarabande


700$ = (515€ )


Las contrapartidas precedentes + asistir a los ensayos antes de una función
/ o una conversación por email con Ana Yepes (coreógrafa, especialista en
danza barroca)




Folías


2.500$ = (1.800€ )


Las contrapartidas precedentes + cena con los artistas después de una
  función /o comida con Ana Yepes (coreógrafa, especialista en danza barroca) o una conversación
  telefónica con ella




Concordances


14.000$ = (10.000€ )


Una representación
  de Concordances – sin gastos profesionales para 15 personas (viajes,
  alojamiento y per diums)










Formas de pagoPodéis pagar con tajeta de crédito o por PayPal (que es gratis y más seguro)Para abrir una cuenta en PayPalAunque no tentais un cuenta PayPal, podéis pagar por PayPal como “invitado”:Pagar con PayPal, aún sin tener una cuentaPresupuesto
de Concordances

El presupuesto global de Concordances es de 60.000€. Actualmente nos faltan 20.000$ (15.500€) para completar el
presupuesto de la producción, y corresponde a la cantidad mínima que nos
gustaría reunir en esta ocasión.
Otros objetivos
para reunir fondos

Si vuestra generosidad nos permite reunir un
cifra superior a la que hemos pedido, os informamos que vuestra ayuda sigue
siendo la bienvenida porque nos permitiría entonces:
- 
Financiar les costos de funcionamiento
del Ensemble Donaïres que, por falta de subvención, no está cubiertos todavía para 2014, ni
para 2015.
- 
Financiar una parte de la
investigación en danza que están realizando Ana Yepes y su colaboradora Anna
Romaní para la colección La Danza del
Siglo de Oro español, Tratados,
transcripciones en español, con traducciones en inglés y en francés.


Otra manera
de colaborar 

Nos podéis ayudar también sencillamente con el
hecho de difundir esta información sobre nuestra campaña de financiación
participativa a vuestros contactos.
Este simple gesto de transmitir la información
nos puede abrir puertas. Es gracias a esta difusión, participativa a su vez,
que la campaña podrá llega a su fin con éxito.
Por ello os agradecemos por adelantado el
tiempo que os tomareis para hacerlo.

Os agradecemos vuestra atención, vuestro apoyo y vuestra
generosidad.
Un saludo amistoso

Ana Yepes, el Ensemble Donaïres y todo el equipo de CONCORDANCES.

story:
hi. we're BITCRUSHER, a digital theater collective

we make plays and put them on the internet.

the idea is to radically democratize the theater
by integrating it into the digital landscape
and by casting and showcasing diverse artists.
we've got an amazing group of performers and designers,
a couple of gigs at pretty cool venues,
scraps of half-finished manifestos, piles of student
debt and a healthy dose of absurd overconfidence.
we'd love you to join us.


THE SEASON

we're raising $$$ for our first batch of three[3] shows.
expect clowns and strippers, dancing cellos
and talking penises, ragtime and death metal,
spilled tea, broken pots, menstruating ears,
and more than one in-depth discussion
of fisting. here's what's on the docket:


THUD!

FringeNYC premiere
as seen in TimeOut NY

a drug-addicted hospital clown has to entertain a misanthropic 15-year-old
and finds the only thing that cheers her up is watching him get hurt
a play about other peoples' suffering and why it's hilarious.

written by Dan Rider
directed by Holly Kristina Goldstein
August 2016, tickets available July 15th



YOU'RE GOING TO HELL IF YOU LAUGH
featured at BAM in Cripfest
all jessy wants to do is have a tea party

what's so funny about that?

created and performed by Jessy Yates, aka Cerebral Pussy
directed by Holly Kristina Goldstein
ONE NIGHT ONLY! September 16 @ Dixon Place



PERFECT FIFTHS
developed as part of the John Drew Theater Lab
at Guild Hall Theater

sam is transforming into a cello. 

she doesn't know why, she doesn't know how
but she knows that she wants to be played.
a new musical about people, objects, and everything in between.

book, music and lyrics by Dan Rider
directed by Holly Kristina Goldstein
October 2016, venue TBD


BUT ISN'T THIS IMPOSSIBLE?

so they tell us.
they say there's no way to recreate the live experience
that its beauty is in its impermanence
and that there's no replacing that simple, powerful act
of being a body in a room with other bodies
that it's foolhardy to even try.

and they're right. it can't be done
and we're not trying to.

we just want to provide an alternative
for those without $80 for a ticket
for those without the means to live in NYC
for those who have to work during box office hours
for those who can't make it up the stairs to the mezzanine
for those who don't feel safe going out at night.
for those who are marginalized, because theater can
and should exist in the margins. for all of us.



WHAT IS DIGITAL THEATER?

  • Digital Theater is theater that is integrated into the digital space, removing the boundaries of price and location and making theater available to as wide and diverse and audience as possible.
  • All of our shows will be professionally video recorded and released online for pay-what-you-want streaming, and for inexpensive high-quality digital download.
  • We're working with our resident graphic designer to create animated gifs, which will not only be used as marketing materials, but will be compiled as a set of reaction gifs at the end of the season.
  • We hope to ultimately create a new model of making work, whereby we can support our company through online sales and small donations, and make our plays cheaply and widely available for years to come.

WHO WE ARE


HOLLY KRISTINA GOLDSTEIN (co-artistic director)  is a director, stage manager and performer currently based in New York City. Recent Stage Management & Technical credits include The Mary Jo Camel Show: Vitals at Ars Nova's ANTFest , Seven Minutes in Eternity  at Columbia University, The Young Artists and Writers' Project at Stony Brook University Southampton and over 35 productions while on the technical team at Dixon Place. Recent Directorial and performance credits are Perfect Fifths at the John Drew Theater Lab, Houseworld, Kate Mueth and the Neopolitical Cowgirls' EVE at Judson Gym, You're Going to Hell If You Laugh - featured in BAM's CRIPFEST 2015 - at Playwrights Horizons Theatre School, and Thud! at Playwrights Horizons Theatre School, which will make its fully staged debut at NYC Fringe in August. 

DAN RIDER (co-artistic director) is a writer, musician, sound designer and actor. Dan was the first-ever musical theater apprentice at Playwrights Horizons, and the assistant music director of Hadestown at NYTW, by Anais Mitchell, directed by Rachel Chavkin. Recent sound design credits include A Ride on the Irish Cream (American Realness), The Wolves (Clubbed Thumb), MOUSE (The Brick's Trans Theater Festival), and 7 Minutes in Eternity (Columbia University, upcoming). Dan garnered over 600,000 views on YouTube with his video, "Doctor Who Theme A Cappella (With Lyrics!)" which was featured on The Morning Show and CNN's "Geek Out!" blog. "Dan Rider is a gift--intuitive, creative, and totally focused--can’t wait to see what he does next!" --Anais Mitchell www.daninadress.com


ARTISTS-IN-RESIDENCE:

• Allison Ciuci, resident producer (Di and Viv and Rose, Theater Row)

• Jessy Yates, performer-in-residence (BAM's Cripfest)

• Hannah Cook, resident designer (The Neo-Political Cowgirls' EVE, the Gym at Judson)

• Dani Leggard, resident graphic designer

• Ian Elliott, resident videographer (NJTV)


WHAT WE NEED

The initial $10,000 in seed money we're asking for will get us through our first two productions (Thud! and You're Going to Hell if you Laugh), allowing us to pay for props, costumes, space, and most importantly, collaborators! The budget roughly breaks down like this:

  • $2150 will pay for our Resident Artist stipends, compensating our Artistic Directors, Producer, Videographer,and  Graphic Designer.
  • $4675 will go toward compensating all of our Performers and Designers, covering the entire cast and crew for our first two shows.
  • $2175 will go toward Show Budgets, covering props, costumes, and set pieces to make our shows look amazing, as well as rehearsal space.
  • Whatever's left after Fractured Atlas' and Indiegogo's deductions will go toward Printing and Marketing costs, helping us get the word out about the shows in the physical world as well as the digital one!



OTHER PERFORMANCES

As if a three-show season weren't enough, BITCRUSHER will be appearing a few other times in the coming months:

  • On July 25th, we will be producing BITS: a Bitcrusher Variety Show (mentioned in Village Voice) as part of Dixon Place's HOT! Festival. We'll be performing snippets from each of the three shows in our season, as well as showcasing the talents of our many brilliant company members! Reserve a ticket now!

  • Excerpts from Thud! will be performed in public spaces as Fringe teasers leading up to the FringeNYC festival.

  • In August, we will be traveling to Odyssey Teen Camp in order to give a free performance of Thud! to campers ages 13-18.


PRESS

  • BITCRUSHER digital theater collective mentioned as one of the Village Voice's must-see theatre performances of the summer as part of the HOT! Festival at Dixon Place
  • Thud! mentioned in Time Out New York's feature about New York Int'l Fringe Festival and the summer's weirdest Off-Broadway plays and musicals.

Bitcrusher is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Bitcrusher must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Hi Everybody!

You, our community, are why we continue to create work and perform and we hope that you'll join concorDance contemporary for our sixth production, Communitas! Please consider pledging your support today with a donation that will make Communitas possible! 

Performances dates and times:

August 20th-24th 2014

Wednesday August 20th at 8pm at The Court Square Theatre • 41 Court Square Harrisonburg, VA

Friday August 22nd at 8pm at The Haven •  112 Market St Charlottesville, VA

Saturday August 23rd at 7pm at Albemarle Ballet Theatre's White Box Theatre •  5798 Three Notch’d Rd Crozet, VA

Sunday August 24th at 4pm at Pollak Vineyards •330 Newtown Rd, Greenwood, VA

Tickets: 

At ABT's White Box Theatre $15 Adult and $10 for students, seniors, and children

Available online at www.concordancecontemporary.org/tickets

Communitas

We officially start our third year as a company with Communitas, a meritage of sensual, jet-fueled contemporary dance. This production features nine dancers, three choreographers, and one violinist. The artists are all highly accomplished professionals who have worked with distinguished names including American Ballet Theatre, Alonzo Kings Lines, Complexions Contemporary Ballet, Oded Kishony, and San Diego Ballet.

Ryan Beck, founder of The Garage Contemporary Ballet in San Diego, returns with a premier of Catalyst Forum, a piece about confrontation, solace and the violation of social norms. Beck restages Serpientes de fuego, a sensual meritage of Latin movement and ballet. 

Jerusha de Waal showcases her edgy and percussive Mode. This highly athletic modern piece set to composer Eric Price’s original score brings fresh, jet-fueled energy that adds another style to cDc’s repertoire.

Veronica Hart’s collaborativeArt as a bucketisbased on the dancers’ individual interpretations of Mark Rothko’s “Untitled 1955.” Benjamin Sanford accompanies the dancers with Biber’sPassacaglia for solo violin.

Hart also premieres …and it was good. A colorful tapestry of African inspired movement set to music by the iconic Bobby McFerrin. The air of whimsy in this solo breathes life into the story of Eve in the Bible’s book of Genesis.

The title of the show, Communitas, is a Latin word repurposed by anthropologist Edith Turner, a Charlottesville local. “It means the very spirit of community. Communitas takes community to the next level and allows the whole to share a common experience. This brings everyone onto an equal level: if you are in a higher position, you have been lower and know what that is.” 

There are a lot of expenses involved in making this project possible, from theater rental, travel expenses, costumes and shoes, to flyers and programs. But the heart of what makes this possible is the artists. Our artists have spent their entire lives training, conditioning their bodies, and honing their craft to present work at a professional level. They joyfully batter their bodies day after day, and work multiple jobs to support themselves to create a few hours of magic. For that reason we are reserving much of this campaign for our artists!

We are working toward developing a sexual assault educative initiative for young girls and boys. I believe that through the language and narrative of dance, we can help to educate and positively influence young people to be more respectful of themselves and each other, and to learn to listen to and trust their intuition. In addition to paying our production costs and artists, funds raised on this Indiegogo will contribute to starting this mission. 

If you appreciate our dancers, any dancers, and any artists, please help us out! Every little bit helps and will be deeply appreciated! Please share this Indiegogo campaign with anyone that you think may be interested in helping us to make this project possible! 

concorDance contemporary

Veronica Hart started concorDance contemporary the summer of 2012. cDc is a professional dance company, a non-profit 501(c)3 organization, and a division of Studio for the Performing Arts (SFTPA). As a new dance company, we are pioneering to build a community and an audience for dance. Our mission is to create a closer relationship between you, the audience, and us, the artists.

We hope to build a personal connection for each audience member that resonates long after the performance has ended. At cDc we have cultivated and continue to create an environment where all artists can thrive, grow, and learn from each other. When artists are able to share their passion with each other and an audience they can create something that is more than the sum of its parts.  

Veronica Hart, company director and founder, has been dancing professionally since 2003. Ms. Hart formerly danced for Charleston Ballet Theatre, The Garage Contemporary Ballet, San Diego Ballet, and Charlottesville Ballet where she also choreographed. Ms. Hart is co-artistic director and an instructor at Albemarle Ballet Theatre. Executive Director Gary Hart brings forty years of experience to lead business planning, finances, marketing, operations, and public relations.

Thank you for your support!

Veronica Hart’s collaborativeArt as a bucketisbased on the dancers’
individual interpretations of Mark Rothko’s “Untitled 1955.” Benjamin Sanford
accompanies the dancers with Biber’sPassacaglia
for solo violin.
Hart also premieres …and
it was good. A colorful tapestry of African inspired movement set to
music by the iconic Bobby McFerrin. The air of whimsy in this solo breathes
life into the story of Eve in the Bible’s book of Genesis.
The title of the show, Communitas,
is a Latin word repurposed by anthropologist Edith Turner, a
Charlottesville local. “It means the very spirit of community. Communitas takes
community to the next level and allows the whole to share a common experience.
This brings everyone onto an equal level: if you are in a higher position, you
have been lower and know what that is.” 
There are a lot of expenses involved in
making this project possible, from theater rental, travel expenses, costumes
and shoes, to flyers and programs. But the heart of what makes this possible is
the artists. Our artists have spent their entire lives training, conditioning
their bodies, and honing their craft to present work at a professional level.
They joyfully batter their bodies day after day, and work multiple jobs to
support themselves to create a few hours of magic. For that reason we are reserving
much of this campaign for our artists!
We are
working toward developing a sexual assault educative initiative for young girls
and boys. I believe that through the language and narrative of dance, we can
help to educate and positively influence young people to be more respectful of
themselves and each other, and to learn to listen to and trust their intuition.
In addition to paying our production costs and artists, funds raised on this
Indiegogo will contribute to starting this mission. 
If you appreciate our dancers, any dancers, and any
artists, please help us out! Every little bit helps and will be deeply
appreciated! Please share this Indiegogo campaign with anyone that you
think may be interested in helping us to make this project possible! 
concorDance contemporary
Veronica Hart started concorDance contemporary the summer of 2012. cDc is a professional
dance company, a non-profit 501(c)3 organization, and a division of Studio for
the Performing Arts (SFTPA). As a new dance company, we are pioneering to build
a community and an audience for dance. Our mission is to create a closer
relationship between you, the audience, and us, the artists.
We hope to build a personal connection for each audience member
that resonates long after the performance has ended. At cDc we have cultivated
and continue to create an environment
where all artists can thrive, grow, and learn from each other. When artists are
able to share their passion with each other and an audience they can create
something that is more than the sum of its parts.  
Veronica Hart,
company director and founder, has been dancing professionally since 2003. Ms.
Hart formerly danced for Charleston Ballet Theatre, The Garage Contemporary
Ballet, San Diego Ballet, and Charlottesville Ballet where she also
choreographed. Ms. Hart is co-artistic director and an instructor at Albemarle
Ballet Theatre. Executive Director Gary Hart brings forty years of experience
to lead business planning, finances, marketing, operations, and public
relations. 
Thank you for your support!

story:
[Xem thông tin về vở nhạc kịch Con Chiên Không Mỏi bằng tiếng Việt tại đây.]


Summary

The creators/organizers of The Eternal Lamb is seeking to raise USD 10,000 on indiegogo.com to bring this Broadway musical, free of charge, to a Vietnamese audience of at least 800, regardless of their economic conditions and religions. 

The 90-minute, Vietnamese-language show presents 22 songs from world-famous films and musicals, which together make up a story in and of itself. While incubated at the Saigon-based Redemptorist Church, the musical aims to deliver the message that Jesus lives and dies in us every day – He actually lives and dies for us every day.

After two performances in January 2015, The Eternal Lamb will be touring major urban hubs outside Saigon starting in early March the same year. 

  • What: The Eternal Lamb, a musical
  • Where: Saigon, Vietnam
  • When: January 2015
  • Why: Share "the joy of the Gospel"
  • Who: Saigon Catholic Youth Group

What We Need 

Cash!

Isn't it strange for a team that tries to tell a story about Jesus and His people to ask for money? We dare to ask you to donate, though, because we're not asking for stuff to put in our pockets!

Ten bucks or a thousand dollars -- Please donate to bring The Eternal Lamb to an audience of 800 - 1,000 in Saigon, regardless of their backgrounds and totally free of charge. 

What You Get

This is something we're very excited about: The eight types of perks listed on the left side of this page are named Love, Service, Faith, Peace, Hope, Grace, Joy and Justice, which we believe are the values essential to a life of meaning and purpose.

The majority of these gifts can only be delivered within Saigon. Thus, if don't live here, we have a suggestion: Let us know who in the city you want to send the gift to. Your relative in Saigon? An orphan you visited a few years ago? We'll serve as a human messenger of yours and remember, we're only one email away. 

Contact

The people that put together The Eternal Lamb are not robots. 

So if there's anything about the musical you find unclear, talk to us! Want more details? Ask questions. Interested in a sample from our songs? Make a request. Have a brilliant idea to share? You're more than welcome to contact our team.

This is a project with a human face, so we'd recommend that you have a conversation with us by first of all emailing our resource coordinator, Ms. Vu Thi Quynh Giao, at vtq.giao@gmail.com 

One last thing...

If you're up to this paragraph, we know you're serious. The full proposal (in English) for The Eternal Lamb is available for download here.

As human beings, no matter how hard we strive for good deeds we still make mistakes living in this unavoidable chain of sin, as if the goodness of Jesus lives and dies in us every day. As mankind struggles against the futility of this world God struggles with us, Jesus living and dying for us every day.  He is the Eternal Lamb, tirelessly sacrificing himself for us all in Love that is beyond any living person’s imagination.

story:
Help us bring this exciting new musical to the Milwaukee stage!


THE VIEW FROM HERE

Music & Lyrics by Timothy Huang
Book by Timothy Huang in collaboration with Elizabeth Lucas

Feb. 12th-28 2016

Starring: Doug Clemons
Direction By: Kelly Doherty
Music Direction by: Paula Foley Tillen

All performances at the Soulstice Theatre space:
3770 S. Pennsylvania Ave. Suite 5, St. Francis, WI 53235


A nameless novelist arrives in New York intent on getting his first book published. As he recounts his daily misadventures in a series of letters to his girl back home, we see through his eyes the colorful eccentric, vibrant and wildly bizarre characters that make up his new life, and the tragic events that make up his old one.
In a musical that is at once funny, and poignant, exhilarating and tragic, The View From Here received its World Premiere at the 2nd Annual New York Musical Theatre Festival in September of 2005.

"Timothy Huang's score boasts masterful plot- and character-driven songs and comedic set pieces... Some have a contemporary throb, but others have a haunting melodic quality that seems torn from the annals of the Great American Songbook, populated by such folks as George Gershwin and Harold Arlen..." - Ron Cohen, Backstage


Meet Doug Clemons!


Doug is thrilled to be working on a dream show at Umbrella Group with one of his best friends in the directors chair. Recent credits includeJames and the Giant Peach (First Stage), Passing By (The New York and Chicago Musical Theatre Festivals), The Wizard of Oz andHair (Skylight Music Theatre), The Story of My Life (Milwaukee Opera Theatre) and The Boy Inside (Milwaukee Chamber Theatre). Other credits include Waiting..A Song Cycle (NYC’s Cherry Lane Theatre) and backup vocals for Michael Bublé. As a vocalist, Doug has been a featured soloist with The Florentine Opera, Utah Light Opera, Racine Concert Band, Choral Arts Society of Southeastern Wisconsin and the Door County Opera Festival. Upcoming projects include soloist for the Vaughan Williams Five Mystical Songs(Choral Arts Society of Southeast Wisconsin), Broadway Buddies (Musical MainStage; Sunset Playhouse) and playing the role of Algernon in Ernest in Love (InTandem Theatre). More information can be found at www.DougClemons.com. 


Meet Kelly Doherty!



Since graduating from UW Whitewater with a BFA in Theater Performance, Kelly has performed with numerous Milwaukee companies. Recent credits include MY FAIR LADY (Mrs. Eynsford-Hill/Mrs. Hopkins) with skylight music theater, THE HANDMAID'S TALE (Offred) with The World's Stage Theatre Company, WHO KILLED SANTA (Tiny Tim) with Umbrella Group Theatre, A LADY IN WAITING (Aria) with TheateRED, and WHEN BUTTER CHURNS TO GOLD (Helena) with Northern Sky Theater. This spring she will be returning to TheateRED, in their production of BACHELORETTE. You can also find her this summer performing once again with Northern Sky Theater in Door County. And this fall, Kelly is thrilled to be making her debut with Milwaukee Chamber Theater.  @kellybdoherty.twitter.com

story:
Send in the Girls Burlesque is an award winning, Edmonton-based, emerging theatre company using the art form of burlesque to create stories that promote conversations surrounding feminism and body positivity while examining historical events through a modern day satirical lens.   
Help us to mount the world premiere production of BUST 'EM UP BURLESQUE playing as part of the Citadel Theatre's Made in Edmonton Cabaret Series. 

WHY FUND US?  (ABOUT THE PROJECT)
Based on historical events, the Bust ‘Em Up Girls were an all girl gang of pick pockets and shop lifters in 1920s London. This work – a full play with burlesque elements- is a game changer for Send in the Girls.

Part burlesque show, part theatrical play, part true crime history lesson, “Bust ‘Em Up Burlesque” is an immersive experience that challenges the viewer’s idea of what theatre and burlesque really are – transporting the audience directly into a seedy 1920’s speakeasy. We are transforming the lobby of the Club and the theatre space, providing a level of detail and excitement to the production that we’re usually unable to attain. These additional immersive elements allow us to challenge ourselves as artists and create a more visceral and unique experience for our audience.

Our partnership with the Citadel is a catalyst to push our work to the next level, expose us to a bigger audience, and has allowed for several mentorship opportunities – bridging the gap between professional and independent theatre.

Our production of “Bust ‘Em Up Burlesque” involves twenty emerging and professional theatre practitioners all under the age of thirty-five. We consider ourselves to be next generation of theatre artists in Edmonton, and aid for this project allows to us to learn and grow through the challenge of creating independently funded work.

By supporting this project, it would contribute to Edmonton’s independent theatre community, give an opportunity to emerging artists, contribute to a stronger connection between the independent and professional theatre community, help to continue the ideals of mentorship between established and emerging artists strengthening our theatre ecology, and potentially garner SITGB national attention, allowing us to tour exciting Made In Edmonton productions to other cities.


WHAT AM I FUNDING?
With twenty artists, two performance spaces and many moving (glittery) pieces, “Bust ‘Em Up Burlesque” is SITG’s biggest and most challenging project yet. The scale of this project requires a budget of $50,000.00.
We have received a grant from the Alberta Foundation for the Arts and a performance fee from the Citadel, but this makes up about half of what we need to cover the production expenses.  We are raising the rest of the resources through fundraisers, sponsorship, donations, performance gigs. and this Indie Go Go campaign.
The funds raised though this Indie Go Go Campaign will go towards the following:
1. Rehearsal space –  We are currently trying to find to safe, warm, accessible rehearsal space for dance and staging rehearsals. 

 2. Artist Fees. Funds will allow us to hire and pay a rehearsal choreographer/ dance captain to assist our production choreographer.

3. Design Fees. Funds will help us to supplement additional materials to build and decorate our set- specifically fabric, wood, lights and paper used to transform the space into a 1920’s speakeasy. This visual transformation of the theatre is extremely important to the immersive nature of our piece and is an important element in the presentation of the play.



WHERE DO FUNDS GO?  (ABOUT THE PLAY)
Scotland Yard called them the most sophisticated thieves in London. In the 1920s, the Bust 'Em Up Girls- an all girl gang of pick pockets and shop lifters caused pandemonium wherever they went. They were organized, they were cunning, they were ruthless and they looked great in a pair of silk stockings.

Send in the Girls Burlesque presents

BUST 'EM UP BURLESQUE

as part of the Citadel Theatre Made in Edmonton Cabaret Series

March 17-19, 2016 at THE CLUB in the Citadel Theatre

"Tonight the Bust Em Up Girls go from a society of thieves to an army. Tonight we change the con. Who's with me?"

Part history lesson, part immersive experience, part explosive burlesque show, part feminist rally, part theatre performance, the Bust 'Em Up Girls have gathered all the bad girls of London under one roof to blow the top off England's organized crime. This is the true life story of Queen Alice Diamond, Baby Face Hughes, Daredevil Stewart and Big Shot Britton, London's most notorious and dangerous girl gang. BUST 'EM UP BURLESQUE is the much anticipated world premiere from Edmonton's smart, sexy, storytellers: Send in the Girls Burlesque.

Creators of the sold-out, held over, award winning "Tudor Queens: A Burlesque," "March Madness," "A Bronte Burlesque" and "The Hollywoodland Burlesques, " SITG's newest "Bust 'Em Up Burlesque" has been commissioned by Edmonton's Citadel Theatre to be performed March 17-19, 2016 in as part of the Made in Edmonton Cabaret Series.

ABOUT SEND IN THE GIRLS BURLESQUE: www.sendinthegirlsburlesque.com

BUY TICKETS:  www.sendinthegirlsburlesque.com

FIND OUT MORE: https://vimeo.com/152612517

story:
http://www.southwarkplayhouse.co.uk/show/luce

Summary

Luce is a play about the fear of homegrown terrorism.  This will be its UK premiere.

Amy’s son is perfect: star athlete, academic highflyer and high school hero.  So why are there lethal explosives in his locker?


Luce confronts pressing contemporary concerns about violence, multicultural education, race and parenting in a gripping drama that is sometimes funny and ultimately disturbing.


Luce will be performed at the Southwark Playhouse 9 March - 2 April 2016, starring Mel Giedroyc, Natasha Gordon, Martins Imhangbe, Elizabeth Tan and Nigel Whitmey. The show is directed by Simon Dormandy and produced by Frankie Parham and Oliver King (for Fuse Theatre).


Luce is by JC Lee, a young Asian-American writer on major HBO and ABC serials whose plays have not been seen before in this country.  It enjoyed a successful run on Broadway in 2013.


Alongside our production, there will be a range of workshops, Q&As and teaching materials for schools and community groups on the crucial issues raised by the play.  It will offer production experience to a trainee director and a trainee producer.
We have funding in place to make the show possible but need your help to make the production as good as it can be.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £5,000 fully to realise the powerful and stylish designs by Matthew Evered, David Gregory and the award-winning Dick Bird (http://dickbird.co.uk); to ensure we can provide a full range of workshops and teaching materials; and to reach out to as wide an audience as possible with the help of a professional publicist.

To thank you for your donation we will be delighted to feature your name or business in the programme and/or on the website, give you a signed copy of the programme and play text and offer tickets to the gala performance.  We have organised a range of packages to suit different levels of donation (see opposite).

There is of course no obligation to receive anything in return, you may choose how much you want to give (enter any amount in the 'Contribute Now' box opposite), and are welcome to donate anonymously.  Any funds remaining at the end of the run will be invested in future productions.

The Impact

With your help, we will be able to:

  • give a brilliantly written and exciting new play about pressing contemporary concerns the best possible production;
  • reach new audiences and engage them in the issues raised by the play through our outreach programmes; and

  • provide an ethnically diverse cast and creative team with an opportunity to work for a decent wage on the London Fringe.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, we would sincerely appreciate it if you could:

  • pass the details of this campaign on to anyone you think would be interested in donating;
  • make it along to the show (for tickets, visit: http://www.southwarkplayhouse.co.uk/show/luce); and

  • tell all your nearest and dearest to come too!

story:
The Fat and Greasy Citizens Brigade (FGC) is the resident theater company of the Grace Episcopal Church in Georgetown. The company's mission is to provide accessible theater for everyone, and we do so by providing free outdoor productions of the works of William Shakespeare each summer. DC has so many great free outdoor summer activities like Screen on the Green and Jazz in the Sculpture Garden. We are bringing free outdoor theater to the city--where people can lay out blankets, pack a picnic and enjoy a performance out under the stars!

This summer in its third season, FGC will be mounting a production of William Shakespeare's "The Tempest" with performances running for three weeks June 9, 10, 11, 16, 17, 18, 23, and 24, 2016 . The performances will be held nightly at 8 p.m. at Grace Episcopal Church in Georgetown (1041 Wisconsin Ave NW, Washington, DC 20007), doors will open at 7 p.m. for picnicking and relaxing pre-performance. 

Your tax-deductible donation will help to provide funding for: 

- Our Venue 

- Set 

- Costumes 

- Props 

- Marketing

We really appreciate any help that you could give! By supporting The Fat and Greasy Citizens Brigade you will be a part of bringing free, outdoor, live theatre to DC! 

Thank you! 

-Alexis Truitt, Managing Director & Heather Cipu, Artistic Director 

For more information and updates please visit our facebook page or our website.

The Fat and Greasy Citizens Brigade is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Fat and Greasy Citizens Brigade must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

The company's mission is to provide accessible theater for everyone, and we do so by providing free outdoor productions of the works of William Shakespeare each summer. DC has so many great free outdoor summer activities like Screen on the Green and Jazz in the Sculpture Garden.
